A four-year-old boy is fighting for his life in intensive care after a kids' theme park ride crushed his head as his mum watched in horror just a few steps away. 
The young boy, who was identified by the nickname Liang Liang, was riding the bus-shaped children's device at a supermarket when the horror incident happened. 
His mum said she was tired after accompanying her son that afternoon and stood about 3 feet from him in the children's play area at Lianhua Supermarket in north-eastern China's Zhuanghe City. The playground where the youngster was injured (Photo: AsiaWire) Liang Liang before the horrific incident (Photo: AsiaWire) 
After the machine started Liang Liang suddenly fell through the floor of the plastic car and became trapped in the machinery below. 
Staff at the amusement area rushed to halt the ride but Liang Liang's head had already been crushed leaving his skull deformed and his eyes swollen and bruised. His mother was standing just feet away when the crush accident happened and watched in shock as her son was injured (Photo: AsiaWire) 
His mum went with him to the Zhuanghe Central Hospital where he was taken into the Intensive Care Unit. Read More Doctor photographs collection of strange items swallowed by children from toys to batteries and jewellery 
According to the family the child is now still unconscious and in a critical condition. 
The supermarket has offered the boy's family Â£4,134 to cover their medical expenses but it is unclear whether Liang Liang's injuries will be permanent. Like us on Facebook
